page.title: 20 BETLEY IN THE 1930's
page.content: Mr.Foster lived in Betley in the 1930's.The highlight of every year was the Shrove Tuesday dance,where every- ones mum made them special clothes.In those days there was hardly any traffic on the roads,the main motor vehicles were the Evening Sentinal newspaper van and the bus from Crewe to Newcastle. There were no T.V sets and only a few radio's. Betley had its own fire engine and Mr.Foster only knew of it going out once to a thatched cottage in Wrinehill. Mr.Foster's allowance was 2 shillings a week.Two important things that happened were the coming of the electric light and piped water.The boys used to wear jerseys and cloggs with metal tips and the girls used to wear pinefores.Sometimes a fox hunt met in Betley and the boys used to wait along by the side of gates and open them when the hunt came near.
